channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potentially loose or damaged manhole cover makes loud noise every time a vehicle passes over it. Noise happens twice with every passing vehicle, once due to its front wheels and once due to rear., 29th December
item.description:
St James Square, opposite the entrance to Synagogue Lane in front of the old Fire Station (formerly a restaurant/bar. This road is part of the town centre ring road and is subject to high traffic volume including busses and lorries. Problem has existed since just before Christmas 2024
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Saint James Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement issues, 29th December
item.description:
The issues with the stretch of pavement on Queens Road from Tesco entrance to the corner at Gloucester Road are persistent and dangerous. There is a small cover missing on a mini manhole, there are numerous small pavement holes, the paving to help pedestrians with sight issues are raised, missing and broken and to add to this the cars that park next to Dominoes are almost always blocking the pavement making walking past a nightmare particularly for push chairs and wheelchairs . As one of the prime entrances to Cheltenham this sets an appalling example. The whole stretch needs to be redesigned to benefit pedestrians, the disabled and parents. There should be no right to park on the pavement at all so perhaps the parking bays should also be removed and double yellow lines drawn to clear up the EEC confusion. Crossing the Gloucester Road can also be difficult as the large tree on the corner obscures both the pedestrian and drivers view. A tightening of the corner could help improve the safety of pedestrians .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Queen's Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentham Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Overflowing bin, people using public bin for household waste, 29th December
item.description:
This public bin is persistently being used for household waste. This means that it fills up too quickly. People are then continuing to leave their dog poo bags there rather than taking them home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 231, Cirencester Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Very large pothole, caused flat tyre., 28th December

item.title: From bafford approach all the way to the national speed limit going up the hill. Cirencester road is in an appalling state. Continuous surface imperfections, bodged previous repairs. It needs fully resurfacing. Utter embarrassment p, 28th December
item.description:
From bafford approach all the way upto the golf course the Cirencester road is in an appalling state and is genuinely uncomfortable, annoying and embarrassing to drive along. Please can it be resurfaced as it's had bodged pothole repairs and surface imperfections.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 283, Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Noisy manhole cover, been steadily getting worse for months. Was fixed temporarily a few years ago and again when the road was re-surfaced, but problem has returned. Sounds like gun fire and can be continuous during busy periods. The buses going by every 10mins is like a bomb going off. Making our lives a misery, please help., 28th December
item.description:
Just before the junction of Green Lane on left hand side of carriageway heading towards Glos, outside 117
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123, Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
